questions.question: In BR003, the conditions are listed as 'APPL-RESULT NOT APPL-AOK or APPL-EOF', but code at lines 104-114 (and similarly 126-133, 144-151) handles errors only if NOT APPL-AOK AND NOT APPL-EOF (i.e., if APPL-RESULT=12). Does this misstate the condition?

What about the double display of CUSTOMER-RECORD on successful reads (line 96 in 1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT and line 78 in main loop)? Is this intended behavior, and should it be documented in outputs or data_flow?

Line 119 shows MOVE 8 TO APPL-RESULT before OPEN (similarly line 137 ADD 8 for CLOSE), then adjusts to 0 or 12 based on status. BR001 cites these but logic_summary says 'MOVE 0 TO APPL-RESULT'; does this accurately reflect the pre-set value?

In data_flow.reads_from, fields_used are 'FD-CUST-ID' and 'FD-CUST-DATA' cited at line 93 (READ INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD). But these fields are only in FD definition (38-40); are they actually used, or should it reference CUSTOMER-RECORD fields from copybook?

The 'MAIN' entry in paragraphs describes inline code from lines 70-87 as an unnamed paragraph, citing 70 and 91 (comment). Preprocessor identifies END-PERFORM (81-91) as a paragraph, but source has no label. How should this be documented?

In BR003, conditions listed as 'APPL-RESULT NOT APPL-AOK or APPL-EOF', but lines 104-114 (IF APPL-AOK CONTINUE ELSE IF APPL-EOF MOVE 'Y' ELSE error), 126-133, and 144-151 show error handling only if NOT APPL-AOK AND NOT APPL-EOF (i.e., APPL-RESULT=12). Does this misstate the logic as OR instead of AND?

Outputs describes 'successful CUSTOMER-RECORD displayed verbatim', but code performs double DISPLAY CUSTOMER-RECORD on status '00': once at line 96 in 1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT and again at line 78 in main loop if not EOF. Should this duplication be explicitly documented in outputs or data_flow?

Paragraph names use '0-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT' (citing 92), '0-CUSTFILE-OPEN' (118), '0-CUSTFILE-CLOSE' (136), but source code labels are '1000-CUSTFILE-GET-NEXT.' (92), '0000-CUSTFILE-OPEN.' (118), '9000-CUSTFILE-CLOSE.' (136). Are these abbreviated incorrectly, mismatching preprocessor parse?

Purpose summary says 'READ NEXT INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD', but line 93 is 'READ CUSTFILE-FILE INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD' (no NEXT keyword; sequential access implied by file definition). Is 'READ NEXT' accurate or should it be 'READ sequential'?

Data_flow.reads_from lists fields_used 'FD-CUST-ID', 'FD-CUST-DATA' (citing 93 READ INTO CUSTOMER-RECORD), but these are only in FD definition (38-40); no field-level access occurs (whole record read). Should this reference copybook fields or note whole-record read?
